meanings.definition: A verbal contest or exchange of insults or challenges.
meanings.sent1: During the flyting, the two friends playfully insulted each other.
meanings.sent2: The flyting between the siblings was fierce but good-natured.
meanings.sent3: The flyting at the comedy club had everyone laughing at the clever insults.
meanings.sent4: Her flyting skills were so sharp, she could win any argument with humor.
meanings.sent5: The flyting match between the comedians was the highlight of the show.

meanings.definition: To engage in a verbal battle or argument.
meanings.sent1: She loved to flyting with her brother over who got the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: The politicians would often flyting during debates to gain the upper hand.
meanings.sent3: The children enjoyed flyting back and forth about who could jump higher.
meanings.sent4: He felt like he was flyting against a brick wall when trying to convince his stubborn friend.
meanings.sent5: The two comedians would flyting on stage to entertain the audience.
